items.title: Capybara
items.description: Capybaras are large, semi-aquatic rodents native to South America. They are the largest rodents in the world, with adults typically weighing between 35 and 66 kg (77-146 pounds) and measuring around 1.3 meters (4.3 feet) in length. Capybaras are well adapted to living near water, and are often found in or near rivers, lakes, and swamps. They have webbed feet and can hold their breath underwater for up to five minutes, which helps them escape from predators like jaguars and anacondas.
items.name: Samuel

items.title: Cappuccino
items.description: Cappuccino is a popular espresso-based coffee beverage that originated in Italy. It is made with a shot of espresso and steamed milk, topped with a layer of foamed milk.
items.name: Anna

items.title: Telescope
items.description: A telescope is an instrument used to view distant objects in space by collecting and focusing light. It consists of an optical system made up of lenses or mirrors that gathers and magnifies light, and an eyepiece that allows the viewer to observe the magnified image.
items.name: Alexandra
